result.execSummary:
The defendant Davina S Barkley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharges waived due to low income.

Restitution set at zero.

timeConds.notes: 30 days condition time with release privileges for work and child care stayed until 4-18-16.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davina S Barkley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davina S Barkley in court with attorney R. Morales for  Francisco Araiza.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Restitution set at zero.   Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEAR with the following conditions:
*provide DNA sample
*court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharges waived due to low income
*pay municipal tickets
*30 days condition time with release privileges for work and child care stayed until 4-18-16 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Alexandra E. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191215 in court 1x on 2/1/16.
Witness fee request prepared for Alexandra E. was approved for 1 appearance on 2/1/16 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Alexandra E. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Davina S Barkley in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

 Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
State filed witness list; motion in limine and proposed jury instructions.
Defendant Davina S Barkley in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case remains on for jury trial in branch 47.

Court ordered case adjourned for FINAL PRETRIAL ON 12-29-15 AT 1:30 AND  jury trial in Branch 47  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davina S Barkley in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davina S Barkley in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 09-02-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davina S Barkley in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
